# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + (lines[end] == "" ? 0 : length(lines[end])) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines)
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello there, how are you doing today? This is a very long sentence that will exceed the text width.")
"Hello there,\nhow are you doing today?\nThis is a very long\nsentence that will exceed\nthe text width."
```
